SEARCH
Package com.cvut.fel.pjv.Controllers

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
com.cvut.fel.pjv.Controllers.GameController
public class GameController extends Object
The GameController class manages the state and flow of the game. It handles interactions between the model, view, and utility classes, processes player inputs, controls game timing, and manages the game state.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameController

      public GameController(boolean logs)
      Initializes the GameController with logging options. Sets up the main menu, new game view, board view, and controls view. Initializes the board, validation helper, serializer, and AI. Starts the game timer thread.
      Parameters:
      logs - indicates whether logging is enabled.

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts the game by displaying the main menu.

    • beginGame

      public void beginGame()
      Begins a new game by setting up the board and initializing the game state.

    • createBoard

      public void createBoard(boolean loading)
      Creates and initializes the board, either for a new game or from a loaded state.
      Parameters:
      loading - indicates if the board is being created from a loaded state.

    • updateTime

      private void updateTime(int left)
      Updates the display of the remaining time for the current player's turn.
      Parameters:
      left - the time left in seconds.

    • validateTurnNormal

      public boolean validateTurnNormal(int[] oldPos, int[] newPos, Colors whoseTurn, boolean aiCheck)
      Validates a player's turn based on the current game state and rules.
      Parameters:
      oldPos - the starting position of the piece.
      newPos - the ending position of the piece.
      whoseTurn - the color of the player making the move.
      aiCheck - indicates if the validation is for an AI move.
      Returns:
      true if the move is valid, false otherwise.

    • getPieceTypeAtPosition

      public Figures getPieceTypeAtPosition(int row, int col)
      Returns the type of piece at a given position on the board.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index.
      col - the column index.
      Returns:
      the type of the piece.

    • getPieceColorAtPosition

      public Colors getPieceColorAtPosition(int row, int col)
      Returns the color of the piece at a given position on the board.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index.
      col - the column index.
      Returns:
      the color of the piece.

    • finishPlayerTurn

      public void finishPlayerTurn()
      Finishes the current player's turn, updates the game state, and checks for a winner.

    • setPieceTypeAtPosition

      public void setPieceTypeAtPosition(int oldRow, int oldCol, int newRow, int newCol)
      Sets the piece type at a given position on the board. Uses validator to check the legality of the move. Saves the state for potential step back.
      Parameters:
      oldRow - the starting row index.
      oldCol - the starting column index.
      newRow - the ending row index.
      newCol - the ending column index.

    • handleWin

      public void handleWin()
      Handles the winning scenario, updating the view and resetting the game state.

    • setVsAI

      public void setVsAI()
      Sets the game mode to player vs AI.

    • handleAITurn

      public void handleAITurn()
      Handles the AI's turn by making a random number of moves and validating the end of the turn.

    • handleTime

      public void handleTime()
      Handles the game timing, updating the time left for the current player's turn and managing turn transitions.

    • stepBack

      public void stepBack()
      Steps back one move in the current turn, reverting the game state to the previous state.
